note.p: Death: House Hill, Nairn, Nairnshire (11 February 1892)
Burial: Crypt, St Paul's Cathedral, London
Education: Aberdeen Grammar School; Marischal College, Aberdeen.

Career: Obtained a commission in the 8th Native Bengal Cavalry (1846); attached to the 78th Highlanders at the relief of Lucknow; accompanied John Hanning Speke on his exploration in Africa (1861-1863); in Lord Napier's Abyssinian expedition (1868); retired at rank of Lieutenant Colonel (1868).
Obituaries: Proc Roy Soc 1891-1892 vol 50 pp xiv-xv signed by J T W
References: R W Home, 'The Royal Society and the Empire: the colonial and Commonwealth Fellowship. Part 2. After 1847' in NR 2003 vol 57 pp 47-84
